placeMetadata.name: Aravalli Biodiversity Park

sources.snippet: The Aravalli Biodiversity Park in Gurgaon is a serene oasis nestled amidst the bustling cityscape. Spanning over acres of lush greenery, it serves as a sanctuary for numerous plant and animal species native to the Aravalli Range. The park offers visitors a peaceful retreat where they can explore nature trails, observe diverse flora and fauna, and indulge in recreational activities such as birdwatching and picnicking.
sources.shortName: Best 10 pre wedding shoot locations near Gurgaon(Gurugram)

sources.snippet: One of the most refreshing places to visit in Gurgaon, the Aravalli Biodiversity Park spans 692 acres of verdant greenery. Transforming barren land into a beautiful and sustainable ecosystem, the biodiversity park was founded in the year 2005. Home to over 20 species of trees, 190 avian species and 1000 species of plants, the park is as close as you can get to a wildlife sanctuary without leaving the Delhi boundary.
sources.shortName: 20 Places to Visit in Gurgaon, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: 21 km from city center 8 out of 35 Places To Visit in Gurgaon. Expanding over 1.54 square kilometres, Aravalli Biodiversity Park was established to ecologically restore and preserve the vegetation on the desert and arid land areas in the region. It was opened on the occasion of World Environment Day in June 2010, after a Supreme Court Ban was implemented on stone mining in the region.

The stretch of the park has different walking trails, the longest will take more than an hour, leading to the gate on the opposite side.

..awesome place to spend time with family, huge space, great architecture, superb lighting and live shows, food arena is great fun as it has food stalls of different places of India . sources.snippet: Sultanpur National Park is an oasis of serenity amidst Gurgaon’s urbanization, spanning 1.43 sprawling square kilometers. In winters, over a hundred species of migratory birds from Europe and Central Asia take refuge in its vast lush wetland. Strolling the misty dawn grasslands resounding with distant bird calls, or framed against the shimmering lake at golden hour, Sultanpur provides a spellbindingly tranquil natural backdrop for striking pre wedding shoots.

The park boasts a diverse range of local and migratory bird species, offering visitors the chance to observe them in their natural habitat. With well-maintained paths, watch towers for birdwatching, and an educational center, it provides an immersive experience in the beauty of nature.
placeMetadata.address: National Park, Gurgaon Farukh Nagar Rd, Sultanpur, Gurugram, Haryana 122006, India

reviews.reviewText:
Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary is a delightful escape into nature, and I highly recommend it to anyone who appreciates avian beauty.

I was truly impressed by the sheer variety of bird species I encountered during my visit.

Arrive early in the morning for the most rewarding experience; the birds are most active during these hours, and you'll witness a spectacular display.

Parking is plentiful, which is a huge plus. The entry fee is very reasonable, making it an affordable outing. Be prepared to pay a separate (nominal) fee for bringing your camera.

We were also fortunate enough to see deer, adding to the overall experience. The paths are well maintained and easy to walk.

To preserve the sanctuary's natural beauty and ensure the well-being of its inhabitants, please adhere to the following guidelines: no littering, do not feed the birds, maintain silence, and respect wildlife. Keep a safe distance from the animals and avoid approaching them too closely.

Overall, Sultanpur Bird Sanctuary is a wonderful place to connect with nature and observe birds in their natural habitat. It's a must-visit for nature enthusiasts and families alike.

I had a wonderful experience visiting Sultanpur National Park. It’s a serene place, perfect for bird watching and enjoying the outdoors. I spotted several migratory birds, including storks, herons, and egrets. The walking trails are clean and well-maintained, with watchtowers that give a great view of the lake and surroundings. It’s a great spot for photography and a quiet getaway from city life. Best time to visit is early morning, especially in the winter months. Highly recommended for nature lovers and families looking for a relaxing day out!

Sultanpur National Park (Ramsar site )  is located at Sultanpur village on Gurugram-Jhajjar highway, 15 km from Gurugram and 50 km from Delhi. This covers approximately 142.52 hectares. The National Park is named after King Sultansingh Chauhan a descendant of King Prithviraj Chauhan. The approach road is good and National Park has decent parking space. The entrance is charged @Rs 50. Around 250 migratory birds find shelter in winter season. The best times are always mornings and evenings. The walk around the park is around 7500 steps. There are watch towers to facilitate bird watching. You can even buy artefacts at counter while returning. Don't forget to rent up a binoculars. Electric vehicles are available for those who wish for ride around the park.

Amazing place for birding. Winter months are ideal, the park is closed from may to oct.
It is serene and peaceful. Well maintained and clean, golf carts available so people with mobility issues or people looking just to unwind may avail.
They have decent binoculars available for rent as well. Saw 100+ species in the 2-3 hours i was there in mid February. Only sad thing was dogs trying to hunt geese and other birds.

What i really like about this senctury is located nearer to gurugram. A really good place to visit in winter specially. Parking facility available ticket price is also reasonable. Place like this should be supported i can say.
Food option is not available so keep this in mind while visiting.

Hello Review Readers,
This place is perfect for nature lovers who can get fresh breath and beautiful scenic views here with eye-catching birds. Just one thing you need to carry binoculars. Without binoculars you can't see them properly. Because they are sitting very far in the water area . You can rent out the binoculars from the ticket counter as well.
I need to notify  a few things:-
1- any type of food is not allowed inside the bird park .
2- no water available inside so carry your water bottle .
3- carry the Caps or umbrella if you are going in summer / rainy season .
4- no food cafe There is not inside nor outside the park so carry a few ready to eat snacks .

Minus point - they didn't manage the parks beauty properly. At a few places it looked like a wasteland because of unmanaged trees and grass. They should beautify this amazing place and should start a few activities for kids...so they can enjoy their bird century experience.

I visited here with my family. Maybe the time of visit was wrong or we just don't have the patience that bird watching takes. Managed to spot only a handful of birds.
Also, it became lonely pretty quick since the park is so big that you will be lonely on the path most of the trek.

If possible, please use the electric vehicle to enjoy the whole park.

Very good Birding place. Offcourse, one has to keep patience and devote time to spot birds. But one given a substantial time, the reward is so satisfying.
Early reaching can reward with sightings of Golden jackal as well.
Best time to visit is October to late February.

reviews.reviewText:
I recently attended a techno concert at Lasser Valley Park, and it was nothing short of incredible. From the moment I arrived, the energy was electric. The natural beauty of the park provided a stunning backdrop for the event—open skies, fresh air, and just enough greenery to make the whole experience feel surreal.

The sound system was top-notch, delivering deep bass and crisp highs that carried beautifully through the open space. The lighting setup was equally impressive, with lasers, strobes, and ambient visuals that perfectly matched the vibe of the music. The DJs kept the crowd moving all night with a well-curated mix of tracks that ranged from melodic to downright intense.

One thing that stood out was how well-organized everything was. Entry was smooth, there were plenty of food and drink stalls, and the security team did a great job of keeping things safe without being overbearing. The crowd was diverse and friendly, and the overall atmosphere felt inclusive and welcoming.

Dancing under the stars to some of the best techno music I’ve heard live was an unforgettable experience. Everyone seemed to be in high spirits, and you could feel the shared appreciation for music and connection.

Lasser Valley Park proved to be an ideal venue for a concert of this scale. I genuinely hope this becomes a recurring event because it set a new standard for outdoor music festivals. Hats off to the organizers for pulling off such a fantastic night.

Leisure Valley Park is located in Sector 29 of Gurugram in the Haryana State of India. It is also known as the Maharana Pratap Swarn Jayanti Park. It is an urban park offering a rose garden, picnic spots, a cafe and a fountain with musical water shows.
There is no entry fee to Leisure Valley Park . A musical fountain is operated in the evenings. It is at a short walking distance from the IFFCO Chowk Metro Station and is right opposite the Kingdom of Dreams .
The Leisure Valley Park is a pleasant green area surrounded by the city’s concrete jungle.
This Park is quite popular amongst kids, youngsters and the locals.
It’s open for the public from 5 AM in the morning to 9 PM in the evening, everyday. Outside the park, and near the entrance, several illegal kiosks have come up, selling eatables.
The park, however lacks good maintenance and upkeep. So many stray dogs roam freely inside.

Leisure Valley Park is one of the best places for a peaceful morning walk and yoga. The greenery and fresh air make it perfect to start the day on a positive note. I usually visit here with my brother, and we both enjoy the calm environment away from the city rush. The walking tracks are well-maintained, and there are plenty of open spaces for exercise or just relaxing. Highly recommended for fitness lovers as well as anyone who wants a refreshing break in nature.

Laser Valley Park is a beautiful and well-maintained green space, perfect for relaxation and family outings 🌳✨. With scenic walking trails, fun play areas for kids, and a peaceful ambiance, it’s a great escape from city life 🌿. The laser show in the evening adds a magical touch 🎆—a must-visit for nature and adventure lovers! 🚶‍♂️🌟

Leisure Valley Park, Gurgaon – A Peaceful Escape in the City!

Visited recently and absolutely loved the vibe here! The park is beautifully maintained, full of greenery, and offers a perfect space to relax, walk, or just spend some quiet time with nature. Evening lights add a magical touch to the whole place.

It’s great for morning joggers, families, and couples alike. There are open lawns, a musical fountain, and a peaceful walking track. Also, the air feels so fresh — a rare thing in city life!

Highly recommend visiting if you’re in Gurgaon and want a refreshing break.

Visitors of all ages are mesmerized as they watch miniature trains wind their way through the meticulously crafted landscapes, evoking a sense of wonder and nostalgia.

reviews.reviewText:
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
“Amazing day out with the family! The miniature train diorama was incredibly detailed, and every little scene had something new to discover. We spent the whole day exploring the landscapes, watching the trains glide through tunnels and bridges, and enjoying the interactive exhibits. The staff was friendly, and the kids loved learning about how everything worked. It’s a perfect mix of creativity, craftsmanship, and fun! Highly recommend for anyone looking for a unique and family-friendly experience!”

This place will always hold a special place in my heart.
As an art lover, I could truly sense the immense dedication and passion that Mr. Adarsh Grover has poured into creating this miniature world~ Neverenuf. It’s a one-of-a-kind experience a visual treat that effortlessly blends creativity, nostalgia, and intricate craftsmanship.
What makes it even more special is that it resonates with people of all age groups. Whether you’re a child or an adult, this enchanting space will bring out the inner kid in you and offer a moment of joy, wonder, and relaxation.
Hats off to Mr. Grover for his vision and relentless effort.
I highly recommend everyone to visit no matter your age, you’re sure to leave with a smile and a sense of awe.

Fun day out with kids

It was time well-spent, experiencing and marvelling at the miniature world painstakingly built over a decade. The kids loved the exhibits and the activities, and we had to drag them home after spending hours there. We would love to visit again.

Note: Finding the place may be a bit tricky with google map sending one on a road less travelled. Please ask the host for directions before you start.

Visited with Family on Christmas Day. Excellent place for a family picknic. Outdoor Railway museum offers model train. City places and other transportation services. Kids play area, birds(ducks and roosters) small cycle track. Crickets net and Badminton court.
Food- Offer limited snacks options, people should carry their food and can use microwave for heating.
Host is friendly and well behaved.
This place is very good place for children and elders to roam, it is a very beautiful environment. Why visiting this place children can gain a lot of knowledge to create their own space.

Lovely host. The couple is passionate about art which can be seen every where in the garden. one must have passion like Mr. grover. Also this is first such type of place in india .. we have such museums in europe. so thanks to him for making such a lovely place.

The NeverEnuf Garden Railway is a charming escape for a weekend outing. At ₹750 per person, it's a bit on the expensive side, but the attention to detail and creativity in the miniature landscapes make it a worthwhile visit. Spending a few hours here is a delightful experience, and it's perfect for those looking for a unique and peaceful getaway. The owner’s passion and knowledge add to the overall enjoyment. While it's a bit pricey, the memories you'll create, and the joy of your inner child coming to life, make it a worthwhile visit for anyone seeking a smaller-scale adventure.

Was a brilliant place. Exquisite models, very well thought and designed. Easily possible to spend 2-3 hours, even for adults. Highly recommended. But make sure you go here with a very experienced driver. NH48 is a death trap.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: The K.C. ARYAN Museum of Folk and Tribal & Neglected Art, located in Urban Estate, Gurugram, was established by the prolific author and painter A.C. Aryan to preserve lost and neglected artworks. The museum boasts a lovely collection of terracotta, bronzes, paintings, papier mache, textiles, books, wood and metal craft that offer a glimpse into India's rich cultural heritage. Founded by renowned painter and historian K.C.
placeMetadata.address: Urban Estate, House No. 2009, Sector 4, Gurugram, Haryana 122006, India

reviews.reviewText:
This is a personal collection of rare folk art and craft and is 20 times better than a museum since it is the effort of a single person, the great phiilosopher and thinker Mr. KC Aryan. Thanks to his family members who supported a passionate lover and collector of traditional Indian art that is fast vanishing. The place is relatively small but the collection is huge and more importantly, the items on display are rare, collected by no one else. Salute also to the Aryan family who are upholding the Indian folk art at personal expense.
The people I met at the museum were courteous and gentle and decent people. Visit is by prior appointment. Overall, very enriching and satisfying experience.
I appeal to the government and all wealthy people to support this cause in their own way.
♿️ This place has
Yes=Ramp access.
No=A wheelchair-accessible entrance.
No=A wheelchair-accessible restroom.
Yes=A wheelchair-accessible seating.
Yes=A wheelchair-accessible parking.
To get pollution free air and wanna hangout with your friends to exlore about tribes and old ways of working. If you want to spend time in the lap of mother earth and its beauty... Must visit

There are treasures hidden in and around the places we live. One fine day, if we are lucky we find these treasures. I am not a 'closed places' person rather someone who is always seeking the sky and grass and trees and birds and so on. However I appreciate the journey of tradition & art and preserving the footprints of great times gone by. Today I visited @museumoffolkandtribalart.in and was amazed at the rare, unique and precious personal collection of folk and tribal artifacts of the great Mr. K.C.Aryan.  His son Mr B.N. Aryan is equally devoted to collecting and preserving the same.
I urge every art lover in NCR to  visit this place.
Note: As this is a private collection and displayed at Mr. Aryan's home, please take prior appointment before visiting. Museum is open for public only on Sundays.

A great collection of ancient folk and tribal arts...
A museum at home managed by Aryan Family.

I went there with my school mates on behalf of my school. It's a typical Bunglow until you enter inside to find out that a whole different world is waiting for people unexplored by masses. The place is maintained and owned by Aryan family. The collection is entirely of Mr. K.C. Aryan, one of the most prominent historians of India. There are various idols, sculptures, paintings, artefacts, stones, ancient items, etc. Director of the place, Mr. B.N Aryan is a very intelligent and knowledgeable person he along with his sister Ms. Subhashini Aryan (Sorry If I'm wrong) guides people who comes to visit this museum. They personally met me and guided me around showing every artefact and telling about it in details I almost felt as if I'm actually witnessing the history connected to those things. I hope this place prevails in the future and all this cultural inheritance of India which is often neglected would remain safe and open for scholars, researchers and students. I recommend you to make a prior appointment before coming to avoid unnecessary hustle. Would love to visit again. Thank you for such an amazing tour of history.

If you want to get connected to your old tradition and culture, you have not to go back to your villages, you have this museum in your area so must visit it and enjoy the aura of this place because they have made so real and so connecting that one surely get indulge in the air of that region moreover, the architecture made by the museum department is so much into the reality that one enjoys the cultural affairs

This place is not great. I spent 1 hour trying to find this place. And the owner didn't even bother to visit us outside. The local people fo not even know that the place exists, so I got no help from them. There was a guard who told us to wait for 5 minutes for the owner, but they never appeared. If a human puts in time and effort to find this place they should atleast respect it and see us. We waited outside for 30 minutes. I was with an elderly person, for thwm to stand and wait for 30 minutes in the scorching heat of gurgaon summers is hard. Another important thing is that they have not put their timings properly on google. They also expect you to make appointments to visit, it is only open for all on sundays. The fact that they ask you to make appointments is not mentioned on google. Thats rude of you all.
the photos of this place also seem fake. They dont have a field or anything. It is an brick bungalow.This was a waste of time and money. I hope you see this review before trying to visit this place.
It's wonderful collection of the pieces and photos of folk arts specially from Rajasthan and all over ,a one man s effort and crazy work.... laudable.

placeMetadata.address: Golf Course Rd, Harizan Colony, DLF Phase 5, Sector 43, Gurugram, Haryana 122002, India

reviews.reviewText: A vibrant hub that exudes positive vibes with its lively atmosphere and stylish crowd. Perfect for food and shopping enthusiasts, it offers an incredible mix of cuisines and premium brands. A must-visit spot!

✅ Strengths

1. Prime Location & Connectivity

Situated in Sector 43 on Golf Course Road, the center benefits from excellent metro (Sector 53‑54, Sikanderpur) and road connectivity  .

Neighbors include high-end restaurants, parks, malls, hotels, and corporate offices  .

2. High-End Commercial Infrastructure

The building is LEED Platinum certified, 25 storeys, with modern amenities such as helipad, power backup, parking, and landscaped plazas  .

Tenants include Fortune 500 companies like Apple, Oracle, Vistara, American Express, and more  .

3. Vibrant Dining & Social Scene

The plaza buzzes with activity: restaurants like Delhi Club House, Whiskey Samba, Paul, and Comorin attract both office-goers and families  .

Strong foot traffic in evenings makes it a lively spot post-work  .

---

⚠️ Considerations

1. Parking Fees & Maintenance Costs

Basement parking rates can be steep (e.g., ₹50 for first two hours)  .

One of the best places to hang out at on the Golf Course Road. Really good places for fine dining and drinks like Comorin, Whiskey Samba and Delhi Club house. The lights around the road makes sitting outside worthwhile.

placeMetadata.generatedDescription: Lohagarh Farms in Gurgaon is a perfect destination for those seeking a taste of village life and rural activities. This rustic farm offers camel cart rides, pottery sessions, dairy activities, mud baths, and various adventure activities like beam balancing and Tarzan swing. Visitors can also explore the local culture through traditional folklore, music, dance, and crafts while experiencing warm hospitality from the locals. The farm promotes self-sustaining rural communities and provides opportunities for locals to earn a living.

reviews.reviewText: It was great fun and adventure, spending best time with family and friends. Truly had an amazing experience. Unlimited food and beverages to rehydrate yourself while enjoying. Do not skip ziplining. You enjoy most when you visit this place in a group of friends n family.

Great place to visit if you are in Delhi. Beautiful place. No pollution. One pass includes food (freshly out of farms), semi-amusement park, camel riding, bullock card riding,etc. Pass costs ₹1100 when I visited. Food is unlimited and is available always.

A nice place to visit with family or friends. Many games are here to enjoy like zip lines and semi amusement parks .You can enjoy the village food like makka , bazra  roti with sarso saag,
white makhan, and gur. Unlimited food for breakfast and lunch with delicious jalebi and gulab jamun. You can watch a puppet show and a bhoot bangla here. Camel rides and bullock cart rides are also available. All things are at the cost of 900 per person.

It is a very good place to visit near Delhi NCR, full of greenery, so much food to enjoy, so many activities, adventures for adults and children. Also, the food was very tasty. Timing of the farm is from 9 Am to 6 Pm, in which breakfast is 9 to 11 Am and lunch is 1 to 3 Pm. It was a very good day well spent with family members. It is only because of facilities and hospitality provided by the farm and people who manage it. And also so many activities for adults  like headmassage,mehndi,camel cart ride, bullock cart ride, nursery,DJ with stage, play carram,chess,ludoo, kushti, trampoline, volleyball, cricket, agriculture activities, pottery making, little zoo for kids also and many more. Special attraction for kids and adult- zip line, air cycling, puppet show, magic show, dhol nagara, slacking, rop climbing, double rope bridge, hopscotch and so many thing like this.
Full day eating counters are open for everyone and so many starters like pizza, rabdi jalebi, gulab jamun, golgappe, bhelpuri, shikanji, chaach, salad, pakode etc

We had an amazing experience at Lohagarh Farm during our recent team outing. The place offers a perfect blend of fun, relaxation, and cultural activities. From playing games to enjoying authentic village experiences, every moment was filled with joy. The food was delicious and fresh, adding to the overall charm of the day. The staff was friendly and ensured we had a smooth and memorable visit. Highly recommended for a refreshing day out with friends, family, or colleagues!

reviews.reviewText:
WorldMark is the perfect destination for a memorable day out with your loved ones, offering a diverse range of experiences under one roof. Whether you’re looking for great dining options, shopping, or entertainment, WorldMark has it all.

Food enthusiasts can indulge in a variety of cuisines at the vibrant food court, charming cafés, and authentic dhabas, ensuring a delightful culinary experience. If you're planning a fun-filled day with children, the Hamleys store promises an exciting time with a wide selection of toys and games.

For shopping lovers, WorldMark offers an array of beauty and skincare products, allowing you to explore the latest trends and essentials. Tech enthusiasts can visit Croma to find the latest electronic gadgets, while those looking for everyday essentials can shop conveniently at the well-stocked supermarket.

Entertainment is also a key highlight, with Inox Cinema providing a premium movie-watching experience, perfect for a relaxing break. To top it all off, the serene poolside view adds to the ambiance, making it an ideal spot to unwind after a day of shopping and fun.

Whether you're looking for leisure, shopping, dining, or entertainment, WorldMark is the ultimate destination for a fulfilling day with family and friends.

Recently on Christmas, I had the pleasure of visiting World Mark, Sector 65 and I must say, it was an absolute blast! From the moment I stepped in, I was struck by the vibrant atmosphere that permeates every corner of this amazing spot.

The decor, music and ambience was infectious, and I found myself grooving to the beat in no time. But what really made this place stand out was the food and drinks oh my, it was love at first sight!

What I appreciated most about World Mark was the sense of community that fills the air. Everyone was having a great time, and it was clear that this was a place where people came to chill and have fun.

Overall, I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a vibrant and exciting experience. Whether you're a local or just visiting, this place is sure to leave you feeling energized and inspired. Can't wait to go back and do it all again!

Highlights:
#-Vibrant atmosphere and decor
- #Friendly and attentive staff

#-Sense of community and fun

Worldmark Gurgaon is a modern commercial and lifestyle hub that offers a perfect blend of workspaces, dining, and entertainment options. While it offers a great atmosphere, the area can get quite crowded during peak hours, and prices at most outlets lean towards the higher side. Overall, it’s a vibrant and upscale destination worth visiting for a mix of work and leisure.

I had quite a disappointing experience at The Whisky Bar & Brewpub due to its exceptionally poor management. The management's lack of customer friendliness was evident throughout my visit. One of the major letdowns was the minuscule portions of food we were served. The quantity was shockingly insufficient, leaving us unsatisfied and hungry. It felt like they were more concerned with cutting costs rather than providing a satisfactory dining experience.

Moreover, the ambience on weekdays was far from pleasant. Instead of a cozy and inviting atmosphere, it resembled a noisy bar with blaring music. The excessive noise made it difficult to have a conversation or enjoy a relaxing evening. The overall vibe of the place was disappointing and did not match the expectations set by its name.

All in all, my experience at The Whisky Bar & Brewpub was average at best. I would not recommend it to anyone seeking a memorable dining experience. The subpar management, small food portions, and unpleasant ambience make it fall short of the mark. It's unfortunate to witness such a lack of attention to detail and customer satisfaction.

The ambience is great and the place comes equipped with a dance floor,  large TV (for matches) and smoking room.

Coming to why this review carries only one star
The music was loud, and continued to grow louder.
Ear splitting and painfully loud.
So loud that you can't have a conversation or tell the waiter what you want to order.
Despite numerous requests from multiple tables the staff outright refused to lower the volume. Wouldn't even consider it (no one knows why)

And the music, the DJ must have taken your favourite tracks over the last ten years and mixed it with the worst possible post apocalyptic EDM. Can't express just how bad the music was.

Coming to measures taken against the pandemic. Only one person in the entire staff could be spotted wearing a mask. There was no social distancing done between tables even though the place was half empty.

Maybe this is how it is on a Monday evening but it was enough to ruin the experience

reviews.reviewText: I stayed in Club Florence in January with my friends in their suite room and had no complaints! Their food quality is good and their front office was always approachable even at 2am when we returned from Delhi and happily obliged to provide us with water and tea. Will definitely visit again.

Ok, honestly, this place is far away from everywhere. Anyways, I attended a wedding, so I'll limit my feedback to that.

The approach is a bit tricky from the main road. You can see the building, but who's gonna tell a newcomer where the entrance is? Why can't you guys put up a board which shows where the entrance to the place is? So you figure out on your own by entering the residential area, and suddenly there's an entrance to the left.

The staff manning the food stalls were OK.

The food itself was mediocre but palatable, though I've had much better food at lesser known places.

Not a single dustbin in the portico & parking area? If someone wants to dump a napkin, cigarette or any trash, where would one do that? At the reception?

All in all, as a wedding guest, my experience was less than average. The management needs to pull up their socks on some points, especially now as it's the wedding season.

My company booked me a stay here and I stayed in their premium room for 3 days. The venue is centrally located and the room was hygienic and spotless linen. A special mention to Mr Pankaj for helping me with the issue of my TV not working late at night. I would just suggest more options for breakfast.

Horrible rooms, cockroaches everywhere in the toilets even on cups saucers and kettle tray. Horrible maintenance of rooms. I have a video to prove my statement.

Even had a function in the lawns but never recommend and event to be organised there. Be careful. Loss of reputation and money. Dream Smith decorator is very 3rd class person. Has a understanding with Club Florence and we were forced to engage them and he created a big flop show and our reputation and insulting in front of our guests.

These type of person should be removed from the panel and customers should be allowed to bring their own persons for the event.

POST REPLY FROM FLORENCE:
Very sorry and regret to get this type of reply from Florence.
Seems matter is not at all taken seriously despite showing video of cockroaches.
Secondly how personal insult, anguish and mental torture can be weighed with the money or the "discount" they are saying.
It is very generic response.
It is near the metro station. Facilities and rooms are beautiful with a spacious balcony. Food is good. I have a dietary restriction on milk and staff accommodated with buffet options.

Even the staff was not that cooperative. They said that we've to buy the costume without even trying. When I found one of our uncomfortable, I get back to them for change and was ready to pay the extra amount of other costume, they refused to change it and I had to talk to manager for that. So my 5 month experience with my personal opinion must visit once because memories are create only in awesome place.Appu Ghar was India’s first and most popularamusement park. Appu Ghar was located in New Delhi India in the famous Pragati Maidan on Mathura Road, and was spread over 15.5 acres( 63, 000 m2) of land.

Best place to hang out with friends and family. The view is breathtaking and the calmness of nature makes it even more beautiful. Amazing food and atmosphere too. Loved the vibe of this place. I can say that it is a must visit place.

I recently had the opportunity to stay at Eva farms and it was an incredible experience! The rolling hills, fresh air, and peaceful surroundings were a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. The farm was well-maintained and the hosts were incredibly welcoming and knowledgeable about sustainable farming practices.

Staying at the farm allowed me to connect with nature and experience the beauty of rural life. I was able to help with farm activities such as feeding animals, and harvesting fresh produce.

Rating: 5/5 stars

Recently visited here and was blown away by its natural beauty. The farm is situated in a picturesque setting, surrounded by the majestic Aravalli hills. The peaceful environment and scenic views make it a perfect spot for a day out or a weekend getaway.
The staff's warm hospitality and excellent service added to the overall experience.

My recent stay at this farmhouse was truly a breath of fresh air! Tucked away in a beautiful rural area, the farmhouse offered a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life. The scenery was stunning, with lush fields, vibrant gardens, and the gentle sounds of nature that made it so easy to unwind.One of the highlights of my stay was getting to interact with the farm animals. Feeding the chickens For anyone seeking a relaxing retreat with a taste of farm life, this farmhouse is the ideal spot. I’m already looking forward to

A perfect resort not just for a relaxing stay but also for celebrations! The property is beautiful, spacious, and very well-maintained, making it ideal for parties, weddings, and family functions. Rooms are clean and comfortable, food is excellent, and the staff is extremely helpful. Highly recommended for both leisure and special occasions....

We took our two young kids to Eva Farms last weekend and had an absolutely wonderful time! The staff was incredibly welcoming and patient with the kids.

The grounds are gorgeous with open green spaces, a nice lawn area, and a playground that kept the kids entertained for hours. We stayed in the family-friendly Eva's Sunrisers Suite which had plenty of room for us and the kids, with comfy beds.

The food was excellent, catering well to families. After long days exploring, we could relax at the outdoor pool, jacuzzi.

Overall, Eva Farms is a wonderful family-friendly destination! The staff was so attentive and made our stay pleasant, even with two very active young children. We made wonderful memories and can’t wait to visit again!

Amazing resort with beautiful surroundings and a very peaceful vibe. Rooms are spacious and clean, food is delicious with lots of variety, and the staff is super friendly and helpful. Perfect place to relax and enjoy a vacation with family.... nd for party...Highly recommended!

headerTemplate.blurbTemplate: Many of us love traveling on the Wanderlog team, so naturally we’re always on the hunt to find the most popular spots anytime we travel somewhere new. With favorites like [examplePlaceNames] and more, get ready to experience the best places in [geoNameWithThe].
headerTemplate.topBlurb:
Gurugram, often buzzing with energy and innovation, is not just a hub for business but also a treasure trove of picturesque spots waiting to be captured through your lens. From the serene waters of Damdama Lake, where stunning sunsets paint the sky, to the vibrant greenery of Leisure Valley Park, this city offers a delightful mix of natural beauty and urban charm. Whether you're an avid photographer or just someone who loves to document memories, Gurugram has something special for everyone.

As you explore the city, don’t miss the chance to visit the Kingdom of Dreams, where the colorful performances and lively atmosphere create a perfect backdrop for memorable shots. For those seeking a unique experience, the NeverEnuf Garden Railway showcases intricate model railroads amidst lush landscapes, making it a whimsical spot for photography. With a blend of iconic landmarks and hidden gems, Gurugram invites you to grab your camera and discover its best-kept secrets.

reviews.reviewText: The DLF Gateway Tower is a marvelous architecture situated at IT capital of Gurugram, Haryana - DLF Cyber City. It actually initiates the stretch of the high-rise buildings representing the Indian and foreign tech giants that are beautifully curated and built at this neighborhood. Located adjacent to the Indusind Bank Cyber City metro station on the Gurgaon Rapid Metro line, DLF Gateway tower was one of the oldest architectures to be constructed at this place.

DLF Gateway Tower is the iconic building of Gurugram.
Just like TajMahal is to Agra and Eiffel Tower is to Paris.
Architecture wise it is beautiful and visible from the distance.
If you will look from the Cyber Hub the view is mesmerising.

The parking is a terrible issue you should be aware of. If you have to go to the DLF office, you actually have to park the car in the adjacent premise. Your parking spot to the entrance to the DLF building, will be at least 500 m distance. It might not sound a lot, but these 500m will melt you in this scorching heat.
Moreover, the guards and the SGV receptionist are unbelievably rude.
Had my parents with me (60 and 61), asked them to let me drop them and spare them the walk in this heatwave. But the authoritative idiots didn't even listen to us, let alone accommodate us.
Gave this feedback to Mr. Rajesh from the admin team, although in vain. It happened the next time again.
Great architecture, gives a great look to Gurgaon which is otherwise a bad city.

office place of DLF LIMITED ( the real estate guru).

Near IGI Airport.
It's look like a great architectural. The building is well connected with highway and metro. It has a huge parking space. The cyber hub is just a few step away from the building.
One of the best infrastructure u can see in dlf cyber city ... coolest building i have seen yet with my eyes

DLF gateway tower is not a commercial building it's an official building for DLF personals. For outsiders there is no entry.
Offices are really beautiful and well maintained as they belong to the DLF officials. The view from top floors is just lit. You can see a scenic view of modern architecture of Gurgaon from the top angle.

reviews.reviewText: A vibrant hub that exudes positive vibes with its lively atmosphere and stylish crowd. Perfect for food and shopping enthusiasts, it offers an incredible mix of cuisines and premium brands. A must-visit spot!

✅ Strengths

1. Prime Location & Connectivity

Situated in Sector 43 on Golf Course Road, the center benefits from excellent metro (Sector 53‑54, Sikanderpur) and road connectivity  .

Neighbors include high-end restaurants, parks, malls, hotels, and corporate offices  .

2. High-End Commercial Infrastructure

The building is LEED Platinum certified, 25 storeys, with modern amenities such as helipad, power backup, parking, and landscaped plazas  .

Tenants include Fortune 500 companies like Apple, Oracle, Vistara, American Express, and more  .

3. Vibrant Dining & Social Scene

The plaza buzzes with activity: restaurants like Delhi Club House, Whiskey Samba, Paul, and Comorin attract both office-goers and families  .

Strong foot traffic in evenings makes it a lively spot post-work  .

---

⚠️ Considerations

1. Parking Fees & Maintenance Costs

Basement parking rates can be steep (e.g., ₹50 for first two hours)  .

reviews.reviewText:
Two Horizon Center in Gurugram isn't your typical office building. It's a prime location for businesses seeking a stylish and well-connected address.

The first impression is impressive - a modern, well-maintained structure boasting a prime spot on Golf Course Road. Inside, it caters to a professional environment with a focus on convenience.  Several business centers operate within Two Horizon, including WeWork and The Executive Centre, offering flexible office solutions and amenities like meeting rooms and co-working spaces.

While there haven't been many reviews mentioning on-site restaurants, the location itself is surrounded by trendy cafes and eateries, making grabbing a bite or entertaining clients a breeze.

The biggest perk?  Two Horizon seems to excel in both work and commute.  On-site parking is available, and the Sector 42-43 Metro Station is within walking distance. This easy access makes it ideal for professionals who value a good work-life balance.

It's important to note that Two Horizon caters more towards established businesses or those seeking a premium workspace solution.  Pricing might be on the higher side compared to other office spaces in Gurugram.

Overall, Two Horizon Center is a sleek and well-equipped option for businesses looking for a prestigious address with top-notch facilities and excellent connectivity in the heart of Gurugram's business district.  However, if you're on a tight budget, there might be more affordable options available.

reviews.reviewText:
DLF Galleria Market in Gurgaon is a popular destination for both shopping and eating. Here’s a good review of the place:

Shopping: The market has a wide range of shops, from high-end boutiques to affordable brands, making it a great spot for various shopping needs. You can find clothing, accessories, beauty products, electronics, and even niche items like home décor. The variety of stores ensures that there’s something for everyone, from trendy fashion lovers to tech enthusiasts. It's known for its unique, independent stores, making it different from typical malls.

Eating: DLF Galleria is also a food lover's paradise. It boasts a wide selection of eateries, including cafes, restaurants, and quick bites, catering to all tastes. You’ll find popular chains like Starbucks, but also cozy cafes and specialty food outlets. From Indian street food to Italian and Asian cuisine, there’s something for every craving. The outdoor seating in many cafes adds a relaxing vibe, perfect for a casual hangout.

Ambiance: The overall atmosphere is lively and vibrant, especially in the evenings. It's a relatively small, walkable market, which gives it a community feel. It can get a bit crowded, especially on weekends, but this adds to the energetic vibe of the place.

Pros:

Diverse shopping options.

Great variety of food outlets.

Lively ambiance, especially at night.

Ideal for casual outings.

Cons:

Parking can sometimes be a challenge.

It gets crowded during peak hours.

Overall, DLF Galleria Market is a fantastic spot for a mix of shopping and dining, with a buzzing yet relaxed environment

reviews.reviewText:
The Sushant School of Art and Architecture, located in Gurugram, Haryana, is a distinguished institution known for its commitment to nurturing creativity, design excellence, and innovation in the fields of art and architecture. Established in 1989 as an integral part of Ansal University, the school has evolved into a prominent center for architectural education.

Sushant School offers comprehensive undergraduate and postgraduate programs in architecture and design. The curriculum is designed to provide students with a strong foundation in architectural principles, design thinking, and a holistic understanding of the built environment. The faculty, consisting of experienced architects and educators, plays a crucial role in guiding students through their academic journey and fostering a culture of inquiry and exploration.

The school's campus is designed to inspire creativity, featuring well-equipped design studios, workshops, and exhibition spaces. The emphasis on practical learning is evident in the design-centric approach, encouraging students to engage in hands-on projects and collaborative endeavors.

Sushant School actively promotes a multidisciplinary approach to design education, allowing students to explore various facets of architecture, interior design, and urban planning. The institution places a strong emphasis on research and encourages students to participate in national and international design competitions, contributing to the broader discourse in the field.

The school's location in Gurugram, part of the National Capital Region, provides students with exposure to diverse architectural styles and real-world projects. Sushant School's strong industry connections facilitate internships, guest lectures, and interactions with professionals, ensuring that students are well-prepared for the dynamic and competitive field of architecture.

In conclusion, the Sushant School of Art and Architecture stands as a hub for design innovation and architectural excellence in Haryana. Its holistic approach to education, emphasis on practical skills, and commitment to fostering a culture of creativity position it as a significant contributor to the architectural landscape in the region.

Sushant School of Art & Architecture or AIT as its known now.... i have fondest memories of.
My first year of architecture was in the old campus, the one that used to be adjoining DT Mall on MG Road.
Our second year was in this newly partially opened campus.
It was year 2001 the golf course road used to be totally deserted.
The faculty at that time was top notch and we were given hands-on knowledge n experience.
Being an alumni I have been visiting the college over the years, yes it has grown and expanded.
I wish this wonderful institute my best wishes and that it will keep producing elite architects.
